messages.message: I'm planning on creating a util function of iterative approach for json.loads() (python) using existing open source library such as ijson (to get rid of memory spike by sacrificing performance). We noticed json.loads() will create a memory spike because it tends to take 5-6x memories for large files during load, and even more memories for smaller files. When we `json.loads` a 60 MB file, it can spike up to 321 MiB (according to my memory profiling), which may crash docker container with tight memory margin. It seem like an issue that had happened in the past as well. Have anyone looked into this in the past? Is there any value to try to get rid of memory spike?

@Josh Xie this might be somewhat related to a C plugin we are developing to help load ibdoc. We have a meeting with Lydia on this tomorrow morning PST. Would you like to join? We can discuss this scenario and see if it will help
yes please add me to the meeting! I'm very interested in this topic :slightly_smiling_face:
Hey @Hari mind adding me to the meeting as well? I had also taken a look at memory spikes in classifier JSON loading in the past
